header.title: Anyone who votes for Tommy Robinson to be an MEP will be let down
header.postText: It was too tempting an opportunity.', 'Last night the serial far-right troublemaker and anti-Muslim extremist ‘Tommy Robinson’ announced he’ll be standing for the European elections in the north west region of England.', 'Quite what Robinson – or as we should really call him, Stephen Yaxley-Lennon – will really do in Brussels (other than perhaps trouser the money and make noise) is not clear.', 'One thing we know for certain is that anyone who votes him in will be let down.', 'For Robinson, this is just another chance to stay in the limelight, get around his recent deplatforming by social media firms, and keep the tills open.', 'He’ll promise everything and deliver nothing, because this is a man who thrives on anti-politics.', 'Ironically this same man who has made potentially millions from his peddling of fake news, conspiracies and anti-Muslim hatred, and is backed by deep-pocketed anti-Muslim organisations in north America – enough to buy him a £950,000 house and take multiple holidays a year.', 'Yet he has the chutzpah to describe Nigel Farage ‘as just another millionaire stockbroker who looks down at the working classes’. Most of us would blush.', 'Like Farage, he won’t be standing for Ukip (despite being an advisor to its leader, Gerard Batten) because he once belonged to the neo-nazi British National Party as well as led the violent English Defence League, and that still (just) bars you from Ukip membership, despite its descent into the far right.', 'In fact, an anti-politics mood, driven in part by Brexit (but also long-term divisions across the country) is creating fertile and dangerous conditions for extremism in Britain, which figures on the far right are keen to exploit.', 'Lennon’s ‘launch’ event (a barbecue at a council estate in Wythenshawe, Manchester) got off to an auspicious start when the local housing group refused permission for his gathering to be held on its land (he went ahead anyway).', 'He was joined by his long-time collaborator in anti-Muslim extremism, Anne Marie Waters of the For Britain Movement – some of whose members are facing accusations of spreading the ‘white genocide’ conspiracy theory championed by the Christchurch terrorist – and he proceeded to break electoral laws on inducement to voting by offering free food to those turning up.', 'The most sorry tale here is that it’s the voters of the north west who will be let down if someone like Lennon wins. To him, this is nothing more than another platform for self-promotion and narcissism.', 'In fact, the only thing he has done for the taxpayer is cost us money: £10m to police his English Defence League, and then all those court and jail costs (18 months for mortgage fraud, 10 months for travelling on a false passport, 12 months suspended for football violence, and he still faces potentially up to two years in prison if he is convicted of contempt).', 'That’s why it’s essential that as many people as possible ensure they’re registered to vote – by the deadline of 7th May – in order to have their voice heard on 23rd May, the date of the European elections.', 'In these Euro elections, which are held under a different system to our general and other elections, the fewer people who vote, the easier it is for extremists to win a seat.', 'So if you’ve ever been appalled or angered by Lennon/Robinson’s constant diet of fake news, and hatred and abuse towards others, then you need to ensure you, your friends, family and community turn up and vote.
header.socioLingVar: Ethnicity - Black,Ethnicity - General, Ideological and Political Identity - General,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments,Age - Youngsters

I’m sure the guy who’s nickname is taken from a violent football thug, who assaulted an off duty policeman who stopped Yaxley-Lennon from assaulting his own girlfriend and who has another conviction for assault meant a hitherto unknown usage of the words “feel the full force” which involved writing angry letters.It’s almost like your initial comment wasn’t made in good faith and you don’t actually want evidence. I stopped believing what was published in the press a long time ago, hence my initial comment.So if Tommy Robbinson (his chosen persona) was such a terrible man, where is the evidence?I've looked as deep as I can but I don't see anything which would persuade me otherwise. I look at the pigs who have their noses in the trough in power at the moment and see far worse, a bunch of lying self serving crooks, and wonder why people like you simply ignore their crime's and focus on someone like Tommy Robbinson? Do you have you nose in the trough I wonder? And you are worried that Tommy Robbinson may actually rise to the top and bring you all to book???You'll be telling us that climate change is man made next!!!

Ian Burrow the evidence is in his court convictions.  And the assaults were done by Yaxley-Lennon, not the original Tommy Robinson.  Yaxley-Lennon has 2 assault convictions and a fraud conviction.  Although you’ve really drank the Kool-Aid, there’s not much point in continuing arguing with you.  The facts are already out there, there’s a reason you refuse to research them yourself.

I could produce a list of criminals that are currently enjoying the benefits of MP's right now but what's the point. You have clearly bought in to the lefty Nazi narrative and are blinded by the propaganda, open your eyes there's a whole lotta truth out there.

commentThread.commentText: Tommy Robinson has one real flaw that all other successful politicians do not have and it's unlikely he'll ever be able to get rid of it and go on to do well in politics...he makes the mistake of ALWAYS telling the truth and no matter how unpalatable and painful. He has yet to do what just about all successful politicians learn quickly to do and that is to master the art of deception and straight-faced lies and most politicians have gained their Master's degree in this.Tommy, like the equally irrepressible and fearless Anne Marie Waters, speaks for multi-millions of genuinely oppressed and ignored working class people and is much-needed to highlight the very real, genuine concerns of many from working class areas who have experienced a never-ending tsunami of totally unvetted; unchecked, society-changing immigrants, migrants, kid-on refugees (economic migrants) being dumped in their areas and not in the leafy suburbs where the university educated, middle and upper class elites in power live...no way would they ever allow multi-millions of foreigners to be dumped in their neighbourhoods, but ok to the working class, decade in decade out and with no end EVER in sight. The working class have been denied their DEMOCRATIC RIGHT OF APPROVAL on this most critical of matters by the bent dictatorial middle class elites in power and only by voting them out and replacing them with the likes of Tommy and Ann Marie, will the insanity of uncontrolled mass immigration be halted in its relentless tracks and reversed through mass repatriation.
